Title 10.38 EXHIBIT C Software Usage Permissions [v.08.05.03]

PLEASE TAKE THE TIME TO THOROUGHLY UNDERSTAND THIS SOFTWARE USAGE PERMISSIONS AGREEMENT PRIOR TO YOUR ACTIVATION, ACCESS OR EXECUTION OF CISCO OR CISCO-PROVIDED SOFTWARE.

This revision shifts the focus from downloading, installing, or using the software to activating, accessing, or executing the software. This change implies that the user should be aware of the terms and conditions before they engage with the software in any way, not just when they initiate the download or installation process.

Export Compliance:
The Software, encompassing technical data, is subject to U.S. export control legislation, such as the Export Administration Act and its related rules, and may also be governed by export/import regulations in foreign countries. The User acknowledges and accepts full responsibility for ensuring compliance with all such regulations. original: Restrictions. This warranty does not apply if the Software, Product or any other equipment upon which the Software is authorized to be used (a) has been altered, except by Cisco, (b) has not been installed, operated, repaired, or maintained in accordance with instructions supplied by Cisco, (c) has been subjected to abnormal physical or electrical stress, misuse, negligence, or accident; or (d) is licensed, for beta, evaluation, testing or demonstration purposes for which Cisco does not charge a purchase price or license fee.
ollama_generated:
Limitations of Warranty: The applicability of this warranty shall be contingent upon the following conditions being met:

1. The Software, Product, or any other equipment on which the Software is authorized to function (a) has not been modified, unless approved in writing by Cisco, and all modifications have been disclosed to Cisco.
2. The Software, Product, or any related equipment has been installed, operated, maintained, and repaired in accordance with the guidelines provided by Cisco.
3. The Software, Product, or any related equipment has not been exposed to abnormal physical or electrical stress, misuse, neglect, or accidental damage.
4. The Software is not being utilized for beta testing, evaluation, demonstration, or other purposes for which Cisco does not levy a purchase price or license fee. In such cases, this warranty shall be null and void unless expressly stated otherwise in writing by Cisco.

WARRANTY LIMITATIONS AND DISCLAIMER OF LIABILITY: While we strive for excellence, it is important to note that our products are supplied "as is," without any express or implied warranties, conditions, or guarantees. This includes but is not limited to any implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, non-infringement, satisfactory quality, and those arising from a course of dealing, usage, or trade practice. However, if an implied warranty cannot be legally disclaimed, it will be limited in duration to the warranty period as specified. Please note that the length of time an implied warranty lasts may differ depending on jurisdiction. The customer may have additional rights under local laws which vary by region.

In the event that the express warranty fails in its essential purpose, this disclaimer and exclusion shall remain effective. By choosing to use our products, you acknowledge and accept these terms, understanding that we assume no responsibility for any damages or losses resulting from their use or inability to use them. Our suppliers and licensors share this same responsibility.

This clause may be amended based on the applicable laws of your jurisdiction. We strongly encourage you to consult with a legal professional if you have questions regarding your rights and obligations under this agreement.
